lexUnit.name: stamp.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: bring down (one's foot) heavily on the ground or an object, perhaps crushing, or flattening it.

sentence.text: Quiss stamped his foot in frustration , then marched back up the steps to retrieve the rest of his furs and make his way back to the castle 's upper reaches .
While some elderly women beat their breasts , stamped their feet in grief and wept , Chikatilo appeared oblivious to the uproar .
Squires turned upon the man in the rented tuxedo and stamped his feet in rage .
Erika stamped her foot in vexation .
He stamped his foot into his flying-boot .
Weary beyond belief , we kept tramping on , stamping our feet into the soft desert sand and lifting them up again like automata , every step an effort â€¦ .
She thrust her hands into her pockets and stamped her feet on the ground , willing warmth to come into them .
The man came into the store , stamped his foot on the mat and went to the counter .
Coleby stepped into the hall and stamped his feet on the mat .
He stamped his feet on the tiled floor .
Caroline stamped her foot against the floor .
Dozens of Pakistanis , Indians and Turks huddle in groups on the pavement , stamping their feet against the cold .
Victoria 's glossy black hair swung wildly about her shoulders as she stamped her feet in front of the mirror .
He stamped his feet like a restless pony , obviously anxious to get back to whatever he had been doing .
Stamping their hopelessly outsize boots , they trudged in single file out of the gutted , white-stone church and slogged off over a ditch away from the barricade .
I shivered and stamped my feet .
Fearon twisted abruptly in the saddle and the grey stamped a nervous hoof .
They stamped their feet and flapped their arms around their bodies to try to keep out the extreme chill .
Already fifty or more spectators , mostly old men and young lads , stood on the touchline stamping their feet to keep warm .
Strangely angry with him , Sarella pushed open the door and stamped inside .
Stamping across the room , the man made as if to grab Michael 's shirt .
She stamped from the room .
She stamped from the room and into the kitchen where she retrieved two stiff and pungent kippers from the sink .
Stephenson roared and howled with laughter , slapping his thigh and stamping in the mud .
Scathach 's horse panicked and he shouted at the creature , which stamped in the water , twisting and tugging with discomfort .
The room erupted as first Harbury and then Riley stamped into the editor 's office .
She flushed and stamped into the kitchen .
A hundred years ago , this man had stamped into the Medici Palace in Florence and nearly wrecked the whole Trapezuntine expedition .
When no one answered her , she came stamping into the room with a scowl on her face .
Nails pulled furiously on the last of his cigarette , threw it down and stamped on it .
The empty tin cash-box lay gaping open in one corner , twisted and crumpled as if someone had stamped on it repeatedly .
She stamped on my right big toe , forcing me to produce an involuntary and appallingly undignified yelp .
But yesterday McLean said it was Burgess who had been kicking and stamping on the victim .
Not in an evil way at all , but if you gave him half a chance he 'd hammer you into the ground and stamp on you .
I 'll stamp on you .
She stamped past him and stood , hands on ample hips , eyes fixed to his face .
She stamped past me and on down the corridor .
He stamped through the restaurant beating the pineapple air with his short muscular arms .
She stamped to the window and thrust the old man aside .
I stamped up the stairs , ran along the corridor , slammed my door and then jumped on my bed .
Father and son had become locked in a verbal jousting match which had ended with Tristram stamping out of the house and staying out all night .
She stamped out of the room .
" Do n't stamp about , " said Hazel .
We had to get up and gingerly stamp around to recirculate the blood .
I stamped around my little island of dry ground to keep warm , chain , but long before midnight I was shivering uncontrollably .
I came into the dining room to find the table bare and Siegfried stamping around .
The committee men slapped Willi on the shoulder , shook the Direktor 's hand , stamped around the music room a bit , making flattering remarks about the view and the garden .
But tonight his thoughts were stamping around his mind wearing heavy boots .
He stamped away down one of the corridors .
As her mother stamped away down the drive Peggy stared after her .
She stamped back and seized Blunt 's arm , rapping on his wrist-watch .
He threw down the knife , turned off the gas ring and stamped down the hall .
He tightened his dressing-gown cord around him and stamped down the stairs to the next landing .
Woolley opened the door and stamped in .
And when that did n't work , he had an animated discussion with team manager Maurizio Mancini before stamping off .
Sir John had then stamped off , muttering curses about public officials who did n't seem to care .
They stamped round the sofa and did that tricky bit of acrobatics that Sid and Ethel showed us the other night .
He must have been pleased or he would have been stamping round here by now . "
He stamped heavily up the stone steps , through the door , along the stone-paved entrance hall .
Then she stamped up the stairs .
I 'd stamp up and down as I walked along , and up would pop the balls that had been buried in the sand .
He stamped up and down .
Stamping up the stairs he went into the bedroom he shared with Eliza .
She knew that Harry regarded her sister as his private possession , and was not surprised to see him stamping up and down and growling like a baited bear .
A tiny , rotund figure was stamping up and down on the daubed green of the false ground , like a drunken redneck at a hoedown , or an aboriginal at a corroboree .
He stamped up and down at the limit of the firelight and listened to the silence of the hills .
He stamped up and down a bit , waiting for Miss Harker to return .
If she 's so anxious about my welfare and morals it 's a wonder she has n't come stamping up here to check out the situation for herself .
He stood alone in the corner of the yard feeling more than a little stupid as he stamped up and down to keep warm .
Then she saw Gazzer , stamping about like a loony , feet flying in all directions .
How long could he and his Sergeant stamp about in the cold feeling sorry for themselves , Charles wondered .
He is also said to have introduced a new and vulgar style of oratory , stamping about on the platform , shouting and gesticulating .
Marc was stamping about at the top of the steps , knocking the snow off his boots .
It rattled it once or twice , peered in through the wire mesh of the gate , stamped around for a bit , and then drove off .
She pictured the man stamping down through his pub , irate and duty-bound .
Spike held a foot above the insect army and stamped down on to the ants .
And eventually I convinced her -- or anyway caused her to throw up her hands in rage and dismissal and stamp off to her cabin .
He stamped off along the tunnel .
In the cottage he dumped her none too gently in one of the armchairs before the fire , pausing only to stir the embers back to life before stamping out towards the kitchen .
They stamped impatiently , legs shifting and snorting breath visible on the crisp , thin air .
In minutes they stood facing each other across a few feet of upland grass , the fresher horses of Jinneth 's escort stamping impatiently .
